title: Boston City Council at-large race: Ruthzee Louijeune
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Ruthzee Louijeune, Boston City Council President, prioritizes affordability issues, advocating for affordable housing and tenant protection.
Louijeune highlights her lived experience, legal expertise, and leadership in advancing housing justice and equitable development.
She emphasizes restoring public faith in the City Council through transparency, accountability, and community engagement initiatives.

title: Boston City Council at-large Race: Alexandra Valdez
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Alexandra Valdez is running for an at-large seat on the Boston City Council, focusing on tackling housing affordability issues.
Valdez emphasizes the need for housing solutions, tenant protections, and homeownership pathways to maintain Boston's community fabric.
Valdez leverages her immigrant background and City Hall experience, advocating for improved transparency and collaboration in local government.

title: Boston City Council at-large race: Marvin Mathelier
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Marvin Mathelier is running for an at-large seat on the Boston City Council, focusing on housing affordability.
Mathelier supports state measures like a corporate fair-share bill and is committed to expanding affordable housing in Boston.
He has experience in military, humanitarian missions, and local community projects, including the Toussaint Louverture Cultural Center.

title: Boston City Council at-large race: Henry Santana
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Henry Santana advocates for housing affordability, highlighting a $100 million Housing Accelerator Fund for Boston's long-term equity.
Santana emphasizes his personal connection to Boston, citing his upbringing in Mission Hill and focus on community empowerment.
He calls for increased transparency in City Council budgeting and decision-making to rebuild public trust in local government.

title: Boston City Council at-large Race: Will Onuoha
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Will Onuoha is running for a Boston City Council at-large seat, focusing on housing affordability and community development.
Onuoha has 20 years of experience in Boston city government, holding roles in housing and civil rights departments.
He aims to restore the City Council's focus on local issues and improve its public image by addressing key civic challenges.

title: Boston City Council at-large race: Erin Murphy
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Erin Murphy, a Boston City Councilor since 2021, is running for reelection as an at-large candidate.
Murphy identifies stability, affordable housing, and reliable city services as key issues facing Boston residents.
She emphasizes leading with integrity and has called for increased transparency and accountability within the City Council.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test readers' knowledge of Greater Boston's latest stories.
The quiz covers trending news topics relevant to the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.

title: Marco Sturmâ€™s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner for the Boston Bruins, securing a 4-3 victory over the Buffalo Sabres.
Khusnutdinov was elevated to the Bruins' top line, playing alongside David Pastrnak and Elias Lindholm, before clinching the win.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Khusnutdinov's hard work in practice and adaptability, especially after Lindholm's injury during the game.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads the New England Patriots to a 6-2 start with notable performances, including a win over the Cleveland Browns.
Dan Orlovsky considers Maye the current NFL MVP frontrunner, citing his pivotal role in the team's success with limited support.
Maye has completed 75.2% of passes for 2,026 yards, 15 touchdowns, and has the third-best NFL MVP odds at +500 on DraftKings.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm in Brookline starts a free farmers market in Jamaica Plain amid the government shutdown impacting SNAP benefits.
The market operates on three Thursdays in November at Loring Greenough House, with contributions from Iggy's Bread and other local groups.
Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey announces expanded SNAP resources and doubled aid to food banks in response to the shutdown.
